sentence.text: Middi said yesterday : ` I was very annoyed -- they should have had the courtesy to tell us .
We let this carry that out for a month or so , and he was very annoyed about it .
I began to feel a little annoyed .
She was still feeling dizzy and sick , and felt very annoyed at herself for almost fainting in Caroline 's flat .
I get very annoyed when I read of selfish people trying to persuade you to change an excellent classical music review into a jazz magazine .
He 's very annoyed because his lack of education has prevented him from becoming a candidate for Swansea West in the general election .
I was very annoyed with her and Zillah .
` He got annoyed when I said that though and said it was n't true , so I 'd like this time to say that although he appears to be very clever on stage and TV , in real life he is extremely stupid . ''

Maureen looked annoyed as she opened her door .
Charlie got annoyed with me because I would n't let him .

Nonetheless , he felt annoyed at Eleanor for trying to wring sympathy out of him in this way .
We were all annoyed with him over not helping with the hay , and I thought good riddance .

She was immediately annoyed with herself for becoming defensive .
Robins is clearly annoyed by the wages package at a time when the Sky Blues are making heavy losses .

He shifted impatiently as if annoyed at himself for having to stop to think .
